alert.note: Alert for Adams; Franklin; Jefferson (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Jefferson, northwestern Franklin and northeastern Adams Counties through 530 AM CDT... At 500 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Stanton, or 9 miles east of Natchez, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Natchez, Cranfield, Hamburg, Kingston, Stampley and Stanton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
